body.p: The IFRIC identified two situations in which a co‑operative entity has an unconditional right to avoid the transfer of cash or another financial asset. The IFRIC acknowledges that there may be other situations that may raise questions about the application of IAS 32 to members’ shares. However, it understands that the two situations are often present in the contractual and other conditions surrounding members’ shares and that interpretation of those two situations would eliminate many of the questions that may arise in practice.
